heading: Exploring Trump-Musk bromance: Can the two powerful personalities stay connected?
subheading: Elon Musk will lead the "Department Of Government Efficiency."

heading: The Rise of the Noodle Boys
subheading: As an era of macho politics sets in, sinewy stars like Timothée Chalamet, Dominic Sessa and Mark Eydelshteyn embody a slinky alternative image of white masculinity in American pop culture.

heading: The real Jason Kelce reacts to Philly’s look-alike contest
subheading: The former Eagles center has a new social media profile picture after one fan made him do a double take.

heading: Supreme Court to hear challenge to banning TikTok in U.S.
subheading: The justices will quickly take up the constitutionality of a federal law that would shutter TikTok next month unless the company divests from Chinese ownership.

heading: Police Can Seize £2 Million From Andrew Tate Accounts, U.K. Court Rules
subheading: The online influencer has bragged about refusing to pay taxes. A London court found that he and his brother had not paid taxes on more than £21 million in business revenue.
